channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Is a 50-year mortgage really that much crazier than a 30-year one?
item.description: Last week, the internet piled on President Trump's proposal for a 50-year mortgage. But maybe it's not as crazy as it sounds.
item.content:encoded: Last week, the internet piled on President Trump's proposal for a 50-year mortgage. But maybe it's not as crazy as it sounds.
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: How NewJeans (almost) changed K-pop
item.description: The girl group had a vision for how to rewire its troubled industry. The industry had other plans.
item.content:encoded:
The girl group had a vision for how to rewire its troubled industry. The industry had other plans.

(Image credit: Jung Yeon-je)
item.dc:creator: Sheldon Pearce

item.title: Redistricting deadlines for the midterms loom as states wait for a Supreme Court ruling
item.description: Depending on the timing, a Supreme Court ruling that weakens Voting Rights Act protections against racial discrimination may lead to more states redrawing congressional maps before the 2026 midterms.
item.content:encoded:
Depending on the timing, a Supreme Court ruling that weakens Voting Rights Act protections against racial discrimination may lead to more states redrawing congressional maps before the 2026 midterms.

(Image credit: Patrick Aftoora-Orsagos)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: After months of infighting, House GOP could vote today to release the Epstein files
item.description: President Trump has pushed back against releasing the files, but shifted course over the weekend after it became clear the measure was likely to pass the House.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump has pushed back against releasing the files, but shifted course over the weekend after it became clear the measure was likely to pass the House.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: The Epstein files are just the latest fracture hitting Trump's MAGA coalition
item.description: Even before the president's falling out with Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, R-Ga., over the Epstein files, some Republicans questioned Trump's policy interpretation of what "America First" means.
item.content:encoded:
Even before the president's falling out with Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, R-Ga., over the Epstein files, some Republicans questioned Trump's policy interpretation of what "America First" means.

(Image credit: Elijah Nouvelage)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: How 'defund Planned Parenthood' came to threaten primary care in rural Maine
item.description: Abortion is supported by 3 out of 4 Mainers, but a popular network of clinics that provides it alongside primary care has been shut out of Medicaid by the Trump administration, which also targeted Planned Parenthood.
item.content:encoded:
Abortion is supported by 3 out of 4 Mainers, but a popular network of clinics that provides it alongside primary care has been shut out of Medicaid by the Trump administration, which also targeted Planned Parenthood.

(Image credit: Greta Rybus for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Trump's White House hosts Saudi Crown Prince with big deals being inked
item.description: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman will visit the White House Tuesday, his first since the 2018 killing of Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi by Saudi agents.
item.content:encoded:
Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman will visit the White House Tuesday, his first since the 2018 killing of Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi by Saudi agents.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Tennessee judge blocks deployment of National Guard in Memphis
item.description: A Tennessee judge has blocked the use of the National Guard in Memphis under a crimefighting operation by President Trump but also put the order on hold, giving the government five days to appeal.
item.content:encoded:
A Tennessee judge has blocked the use of the National Guard in Memphis under a crimefighting operation by President Trump but also put the order on hold, giving the government five days to appeal.

(Image credit: George Walker IV)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: CPB agrees to revive a $36 million deal with NPR killed after Trump's pressure
item.description: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting agreed Monday to fulfill a $36 million, multi-year contract with NPR that it had yanked after pressure from the Trump White House.
item.content:encoded:
The Corporation for Public Broadcasting agreed Monday to fulfill a $36 million, multi-year contract with NPR that it had yanked after pressure from the Trump White House.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik/Getty Images and Phil McCarten/Invision/AP)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: The U.N. Security Council approves a U.S. plan for a Gaza stabilization force
item.description: The plan authorizes a security force in the devastated territory and envisions a possible path to an independent Palestinian state. Russia, which had circulated a rival resolution, abstained along with China on the 13-0 vote.
item.content:encoded:
The plan authorizes a security force in the devastated territory and envisions a possible path to an independent Palestinian state. Russia, which had circulated a rival resolution, abstained along with China on the 13-0 vote.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
